channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI is coming for entry-level jobs. Bill Gates says Gen Z may not be safe no matter how well they learn to use it
item.description: Gen Z job applicants are facing headwinds when entering the job market due to AI.

item.title: North Korean IT worker infiltrations exploded 220% over the past 12 months, with GenAI weaponized at every stage of the hiring process
item.description: Cybersecurity firm Crowdstrike red-flags a new North Korean software development hire to clients just about once a day.

item.title: From law firm to AI powerhouse: How Accenture’s Julie Sweet hacked the CEO track
item.description: Julie Sweet’s rise from law partner to Accenture CEO shows that curiosity and range, not credentials, are the new power skills.

item.title: Former General Electric CEO Jack Welch once claimed the jobs numbers were faked. How did that turn out?
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Greer says U.S.-China talks ‘about halfway there’ on rare earths
item.description: The U.S. Trade Representative said Washington was focused on having rare earth magnets "flow as freely as it did before the control."

item.title: Stocks get hit as clouds gather — but history suggests it’s too soon to panic
Swiss stocks struggle as market reopens following U.S. tariff shock
After 'dog days' of July, investors may not be ready for what comes next
Dow poised for 300-point gain, S&P 500, Nasdaq set to rebound from Friday losses
Opinion: What happens if a court ruling strikes down Trump’s tariffs?
